Articles.Content:
Hey everyone!

I\'ve had the full copy of the game for a few weeks now, and I can just not put it down. For a game so early in it\'s development cycle it\'s absolutely addictive.

So I just wanted to introduce myself and say keep up the great work guys, I\'m really looking forward to when this game hits full release!

Thanks for the great game and if anybody wants to they can check out my let\'s plays in Kerbal space program (I\'m not very good at the game yet so any tips are welcome ) It\'d really help a fellow kerbanaught out.

Thanks again guys.

-Mattin

Hi Spartanmattin

Welcome to the KSP community, that\'s a pretty cool video you made, and if you need help with anything just ask around the Forums and people will do their best to help you out.

Have fun flying

Welcome ,

I have two tips for you:

[list type=decimal]

[li]Having SAS on when you take off helps keep the plane stable on the runway[/li]

[li]Make sure the wheels are perpendicular to the runway; this also helps the plane travel in a straight line.[/li]

Happy Engineering.

Hello!

My greatest tip is to ALWAYS check for a parachute. Not having one can make landing incredibly scary.

Also,

In before Skunky.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Good sir. That plane, actually, could get into orbit. If you have enough fuel. You can make a 13 to rocket to get in to orbit. If you can get in into space, with one small landing engine. (Although, it would be slow as hell) G\'bye!
